title.narrative: OUTPUT 5.2 INTEGRATED SOCIAL PROTECTION

description.narrative: Output 5.2:Integrated social protection services are received by the most vulnerable and disadvantaged children, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, more children in Yemen and their families who live in poverty (income and multi-dimensional) access adequate social protection and social services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 5.2:Integrated social protection services are received by the most vulnerable and disadvantaged children

description.narrative: UNICEF continued prioritizing integrated social protection agenda in 2021. In 2021, it witnessed several key achievements mainly the scale-up of IMSEA and Cash plus projects to reach more marginalized beneficiaries with an integrated social protection package. This included Muhamasheen children, adolescents, and children with disabilities. The social assistance component of IMSEA was also scaled up through a social transfer initiative in response to the multiple crises faced by Yemeni people, including COVID-19 socio-economic impact and the malnutrition crisis. In addition, community engagement and social investment pillars of the IMSEA were activated in 2021. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:10/01/2022
